etymology.description: 拉(拉) (lā, "pull") + 制(製) (zhì, "make or manufacture") comes together to refer to the action of pulling or drawing a material, specifically in a manufacturing context.
etymology.interpretation: The combination of 拉(拉) (lā, "pull") and 制(製) (zhì, "make or manufacture") reflects a process in manufacturing where metal is drawn out through pulling, a common technique in the fabrication of metal products.

examples.chinese: 现代工厂运用拉制技术(現代工廠運用拉製技術)，制造精密金属线材(製造精密金屬線材)。
examples.pinyin: Xiàndài gōngchǎng yùnyòng lāzhì jìshù, zhìzào jīngmì jīnshǔ xiàncái。
examples.english: Modern factories use the metal drawing process to manufacture precision metal wires.

examples.chinese: 借助拉制工艺(借助拉製工藝)，金属板材变得更加坚韧(金屬板材變得更加堅韌)。
examples.pinyin: Jièzhù lāzhì gōngyì, jīnshǔ bǎncái biàn de gèngjiā jiānrèn。
examples.english: With the help of the metal drawing process, metal plates become even tougher.
